video.title: React JS Course for Beginners - 2021 Tutorial
video.description:
This is a full premium course. Learn React.js from the ground up with fundamentals to more intermediate and advanced topics. You will learn by building a real app!

💻 Starter files: https://github.com/weibenfalk/react-rmdb-v3-starter-files

Course from Thomas Weibenfalk. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnnnWy4UTYN258FfVGeXBbg

Learn: 
- React
- JSX
- Styled Components
- React Router
- State and Props
- Context
- CSS 
- API handling
- Hooks 
- Typescript
- Persist state in SessionStorage
- Deploy to Netlify
- And MUCH more ...

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:10) Introduction
⌨️ (0:00:57) The App

replies.author: Geoffrey Wade
replies.text:
1) At around 17:21, he tells us to navigate inside a folder (e.g. My React Apps - my name not his) where you want to create your application. I did this using the VS Code terminal.

2) He then runs 'npx create-react-app react-rmdb' which creates the react-rmdb subdirectory and then bootstraps a React application into it.  

3) Keep in mind that the current working directory is still My React Apps (his is named something else). So he then runs 'cd react-rmdb' to change the current working directory to the react-rmdb subdirectory.

4) He then runs 'npm i history react-router-dom@next' which installs those packages into the node-modules subdirectory of react-rmdb. If you are using VS Code, check it out, you'll see everything I'm saying. You may need to refresh your directories.

Hope this helps.

topLevelComment.author: Enes K
topLevelComment.text:
Before I start to that course, I checked the comments if this is React beginner friendly or not. I could not see any proper review, so I trusted the title of the course and started. I have spent almost 1.5 hours on this so far.. I know JS, I know backend etc. And I can assure you that this is not a beginner friendly nor intermediate,  nor advanced friendly course.

We are talking about what is JSX, and then immediately diving into props, components etc without any clue. Then we start to type "stuff", again without knowing anything. But on the other hand, we are talking about JS destructing meanwhile. So, if this is NOT beginner friendly, why we are talking about stuff like destructing? If this is beginner friendly, why we are NOT talking about what the heck is a component, props, states etc in advance? Why we are directly diving in ???

So heads up to anyone who is considering following this course. You will get lost in no time. If you don't believe me, be my guest and go on. You will agree with me soon or later.

replies.author: Owais Ali
replies.text: You are right i though it will be basic level course believe me I have knowledge of JS and REact and already have created 3 to 5 web apps in react and vanilla JS but this is not a beginner level this guy is writing a lot of advance coding without explaining it. I will recommend scrimba basic react course before starting this one
